request_pathways.name: Medical Records Electronic Self Request (Swellbox wizard)

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (practice-specific variant for Associates in Family Practice)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: ACP links to a Swellbox-powered 'Medical Records Electronic Self Request' wizard alongside downloadable PDF authorization forms on its Patient Forms page.

red_flags: Primary ROI form (form-1) contains no submission instructions — no address, fax, email, or portal URL
Fee disclosure is confusingly placed under the 'Other' purpose checkbox rather than in a dedicated section
No Spanish version of the primary ROI form despite Tucson's ~42% Hispanic population
bright_spots: Swellbox online electronic self-request wizard provides a fully digital records request pathway
No Social Security Number requested on primary ROI form
Comprehensive form ecosystem: 7 documents covering general release, imaging, access designation, amendment, and Spanish minor form
HIPAA amendment request form published online — uncommon for physician practices
Protected records (HIV, behavioral health, substance abuse) clearly separated with distinct consent checkboxes

findability.rationale: Rubric level 4 (easy to find with basic navigation or simple search): forms page is linked from main navigation as 'Patient Forms,' multiple web search strategies returned direct PDF URLs, and the Swellbox wizard link is on the same page — all accessible within 2-3 clicks from the homepage.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Rubric level 3 (usable digitally with workarounds): all seven PDF forms have zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite completion, but the Swellbox online wizard provides an electronic self-request alternative; the PDF forms themselves have native text layers enabling assistive technology use.

content_design.rationale: Rubric level 3 (adequate but has notable problems): form-1 has clear section headers and logical organization on a single page, but fee disclosure is confusingly placed under the 'Other' checkbox, submission instructions are entirely absent, and the 1-year default records limitation is buried in parenthetical text.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Rubric level 3 (patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them): the PDF form is a generic third-party authorization with 'Name of Physician/Organization' labels implying provider recipients, though the Swellbox 'Electronic Self Request' wizard suggests a patient-oriented pathway exists alongside the generic form.

compliance.rationale: Rubric level 4 (minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding): fees are within HIPAA limits ($0.07/page, $6.50/disc), no notarization or witness required, expiration and revocation properly stated, but the undefined 'shipping and handling' surcharge and missing re-disclosure warning are minor gaps.

overall.summary: ACP provides easy-to-find forms and a Swellbox electronic self-request option that elevates the digital experience, but the primary PDF form is a generic non-fillable third-party authorization lacking submission instructions and patient-access-specific design.
